column3: Good hotel in a busy city
column4: Overall a good hotel with a nice lobby and restaurant. The room was nice with a nice shower. The toilet which was separate from the bathroom was the only problem as it was so tiny it was difficult to close the door. The breakfast spread was pretty good and had a good selection. We were on the second floor so the noise from the street below was very loud. The fifth floor would be a better choice.

I was brought to this hotel by mistake by my Moroccan taxi driver. I decided to enter the lobby and greeted by the reception staff Mr Hamza Sabir. He did not let me go back to the hotel I was intending to visit. I was so impressed by his welcome that I decided to stay and confirm my reservation. To my delight the hotel is outstanding and it's location not far from the station and the Centre. The decor is modern and clean, excellent bedding and amenities.This is a quality outfit with the staff who really care. The breakfast was superb, just the right amount of sparead. This hotel is very much 4 star Plus business outfit and you can not go wrong in your stay. I am reviewing this hotel in comparison to my return from a 5 star luxury stay at "Mazagan". I would just like to express‚Ä¶

column3: Nice hotel, ugly position and slow service
column4: Very surprised by the location of the hotel in the middle of an old area, very dirty and with no places around to visit or restaurants to go. Far enough from the modern part and from the real old medina it becomes difficult to enjoy the city which is not the nicest one in Morocco

Easy to find from the train station‚Äîtake light rail about 3 stops. The hotel was great! We were upgraded and it was awesome. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only complaint was we had to call 4 times to have housekeeping come up with the sheets for the pullout bed. We ate at Yuzu and it was very good. Calm and peaceful from the busy streets.

This hotel is a gem. The location is decent (not great) but once you enter the hotel, you realize why it makes sense to stay here. The decor is lovely, the rooms are spaciousand, and the beds are very comfortable. Everything was very clean. My stay was great. The staff are also very welcoming and helpful. Last but not least, the spa is AMAZING.

Front desk staff were knowledgeable and warm. Beds were comfortable - on the firm side as we like them. Memory foam pillows. Breakfast buffet was good with a variety of breads, proteins, and fruit. Good location: there‚Äôs an ATM and bureau d‚Äô change around the corner, a coffee shop across the street, the tram stops out front. Ten minutes‚Äô taxi ride to the Hassan II Mosque and Casa Voyageurs train station.

Stayed here 1 night as part of a group tour. Flew out the next day headed back home. Room was a typical business hotel. Bathroom quite nice. Room clean and quiet. Had a nice dinner at the hotel (our departure dinner for our group).

column3: Bait & Switch Pricing On Hotel Website
column4: The Radisson website shows prices as $115 USD a night and that you are getting the best price compared to all the hotel booking engines (Which they show you on the side bad) but then if you read the fine print of the price they are showing , it conveniently doesn't include the VAT in the price, so of course it is lower. It is shameful in 2022 that companies are still engaging in this practice. SHOW THE TOTAL PRICE UP FRONT RADISSON

column3: Booking.com lie for the real Prices in Hotel
column4: In Booking com frontpage is Price 130 EUR for one person bath when i start to pay in booking.com comes Priceline 175 EUR. This in on a fare business and nowbody take respinsobility. Not good for booking .com users and off course not for Hotel. 5 star hotel must be correct in payments , bath use same tricky metods.Not good.And be carefull yo have reservation via booking.com in this Hotel.

We stayed one night here before returning from our OAT tour of Morocco. This is a large chain hotel, and we stayed in a ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù room, which is actually a bit small, but clean and comfortable. We had their buffet breakfast before taking the one-hour ride to the airport in the morning. The pictures and general description of the ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù room on the hotel‚Äôs website are accurate. We can recommend this hotel.

Stayed at hotel on business trip. Unable to get shower to reasonable temperature, so had mainly lukewarm/cold showers. One window would not close properly resulting in constant noise from street outside during evening/night. Loud party on ground floor on a Thursday night kept me up until 1am in my 3rd floor room because music was so loud and hotel did not manage the event so it did not disturb guests.

The Radisson Blu is a quality hotel within walking distance of the Old Medina (10 minutes) and even the Hassan II Mosque (25 - 30 minutes). The hotel is clean and bright. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and very clean. The bathroom is clean, and the shower had good water pressure. The restaurants (both the main restaurant on the main floor and the sushi/seafood restaurant on the mezzanine) are good places to eat and be comfortable. The dining staff, especially the manager Mohammed, are easy to talk with and very good at service. The selection and quality of food was very good; our group especially liked the Fried Eggplant at the sushi restaurant. Speaking of hotel staff, we have to give Mohammed of the bell staff kudos for his‚Ä¶

The staff at the reception was very welcoming, the housekeeping team are really professional and remember all your preferences. The breakfast was also good. Unfortunately we didn't have the opportunity to try the spa

I was there few days ago with my husband for our wedding anniversary. They were so nice to decorate our room and give us an upgrade to a suite with a view in the port. The check in was fast and smooth and staff are very professional.

The hotel is in downtown and conveniently located to restaurants and shopping malls. There is lots of construction in this area so took a bit of long time to reach it from the airport. The staff is very courteous and the chef is very happy to prepare what you like

My colleague and I were traveling for work and we felt very taken care of. Unfortunately, I left personal belongings in the room and 20 minutes after check out, we were calling the hotel to let them know and ask to arrange for the belongings to be sent to me. I finally got through to a kind gentleman who confirmed to me that this was possible. I followed the instructions and emailed their info email address with the list of belongings, my shipping address etc. I have emailed them 3 times and have not heard anything back, I have also emailed their head of sales and marketing who was visible on their website asking for assistance, and yet no response. I am very disappointed with their lack of response as it was confirmed by a staff member that it was possible to have my‚Ä¶

column3: Modern elegance in the heart of Casablanca for first time travelers in Morocco
column4: Modern, sophisticated and classy finishes in the hotel and the rooms. Perfect touch down as our first stop in Morocco as we step into Casablanca. Conveniently located and easy to get around. The stars are friendly and made the stay easy, made us feel welcome and helped orient us to what we hope will be a great journey in Morocco. The breakfast spread was also a welcome surprise in the morning. Highly recommend this hotel for its convenient location and modern design.

Special thanks to Mr. Mohamed Manar who made the experience worth while and was very welcoming and is the main reason why I would visit the hotel again in my next trip to Casa. He made sure all our needs were taken care of.

The rooms are comfortable and modern, but the neighborhood was full of traffic, noisy and run-down. I did not feel safe visiting a local ATM for currency. The rooftop pool has a great view of the city, but the food service at the pool is not part of the hotel restaurant and prices are very high. Breakfast buffet was very good.

We were supposed to get a room for 3 adults. We got a room with a king-sized bed. When we tried to speak with the desk employees, they said they would bring a roll-away. Putting the roll-away in the room meant not being able to walk between the beds and not having room for luggage. Could not get room with two beds Wait staff in the bar didn't pay attention to customers and took forever to get a drink. Breakfast was poor at best. Was supposed to be buffet however there were no utensils to dish out the food. When asked, the staff didn't seem to pay attention; just nodded and went along their way. Ordered coffee three times and never got it

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel was nicely decorated and in a good location. Our room was spacious, clean and well supplied with amenities. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and there were blackout curtains - I had the best sleep in our 3 week holiday! The breakfast was very good although it was difficult for the staff to understand our requests as not a lot of English was spoken. On our first night we had dinner in the International restaurant. It was very good and the service was excellent. On another evening we ate in the Japanese fusion restaurant. Unfortunately, despite being assured that the food was fresh we both were very ill the next day and for many days after that. The only other meals we ate before and after that meal was breakfast at the‚Ä¶

Please dont waste your money. The hotel was in a poor shape the staff were unhelpful. If a member of management is reading this review please go undercover and stay there and see it for yourself.. There 10 staff members standing around at the resturant yet it was diifcult to get here attention to get drink. We asked for a taxi at the front desk we were told arrange it your self. We called many times for a blankent nothing came up. The list is endless. The following day at i beleive there was man in the blue suit he must of been management beacuse the staff were actually working.

The hotel staff are very attentive and helpful. The rooms are well appointed and included a coffee maker which we found to be a rarity in Morocco. Lovely wine glasses and a wine/beer shop just around the corner was another advantage as was a full grocery store close by. We utilized the spa services of the hotel which were excellent as was the very warm pool in the spa area. Everything about the hotel including the food was beyond reproach. We highly recommend this establishment.

column3: Very unprofessional and not worthy of a five star title!
column4: Upon arrival I was charged twice, once on my debit card by the receptionist and another time on my credit card by the hotels reservation team. This issue wasn‚Äôt resolved upon checkout after 5 days and I yet am to receive a reimbursement. The shower head was spraying water upwards onto the ceiling where the paint was cracking and falling into me. The curtains were broken and let it a lot of light. The streets were so loud where I kept waking up to the noise the train made thinking it was an alarm every couple of mins. The evening shift receptionist Mohammed recommended a fine dining hotel, which I asked him to make us a reservation at and he refused and said just walk in, yet we were turned back at the restaurant for not having a reservation and for wearing shorts, which he‚Ä¶

Reserved a room for 4 people. Arrived to check in and the first thing they said, "You'll never fit in that room. Would you like to pay for a larger room?" I used the website and indicated the ages of all the people in the room. Pretty sure I was charged for an upgrade even though I didn't upgrade. Staff were friendly enough. Rooftop lounge was a little tired.

Our room was very comfortable but our experience in the restaurant was less than satisfactory. Arriving for breakfast, half the tables were occupied and the remainder had dirty dishes and crumbs on them. We were directed to sit anywhere we wanted, not a great prospect given that all empty tables had not been cleared or cleaned. We sat at a table and the waiter brought coffee and placed it on the uncleared table in front of us. I asked the water to please clean the table before we used it, which he did, after conveying an expression of bewilderment. As we sat at our now clean table with two cups of coffee before us and nothing else on the table, the majority of the staff stood about talking to each other or having prolonged discussions with other guests. No one seemed to notice‚Ä¶

column3: Birthday trip. First stop in Morocco.
column4: Facilities very clean, staff reserved but approachable. They stick to the 3pm checking rule. We expected a little more help finding our room, also, had to call for help several times to figure out how to work the lights for bathrooms n toilets. Breakfast staff was stiff, no return smiles or acknowledgement. Teapot with tea was very hot with no cloth to use for pouring tea. I used my cloth napkin. We received a very nicely written welcome note with evening tray of goodies ( fruits n macaroon, etc). Location was good for us.

Great service, facilities and food Staff really friendly and helpful Room very clean and comfortable bedding Good breakfast and lunch menu Nice spa and rooftop pool Would definitely recommend and come back

The hotel is ideally located and the staff was excellent. The rooms were very comfortable and attractive. Meriem and Chaimaa at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating to me as a first time traveler to Casablanca.

I enjoyed the body scrub and the massage the next day. Great place to unwind after two weeks touring around Morocco. Relaxing comfortable place to stay. Large rooms with comfortable beds. I would recommend.

The hotel is outstanding. Staff are excellent: Myriam at the reception is a wonderful young woman, her professionalism is out of this world. Mohammed, reception chief, khawla, soumia, Ayoub, Nabil, the restaurant staff, are so nice and welcoming, big smiles everyday, they will jump to satisfy any request. Myriam the housekeeper is a beautiful young girl who will do anything to make your stay comfortable and memorable. The valet boys are amazing, they will help before you even ask them. Everyday they would bring the car in front of the hotel entrance before we even ask. Overall our stay at Radisson was wonderful. I strongly recommend this hotel. In my opinion the best in all Casablanca. Can‚Äôt thank the staff enough. Very helpful, nice and welcoming team. Keep up the wonderful‚Ä¶

Arranged transfer to the airport, checked and confirmed price in 3 different occasions ended up in paying the driver 500 MAD instead of the 300 agreed. Sent a message to the hotel via booking.com, nobody Nobody ever reacted.

Overall a below par experience. Rooms 7 /10 lets say the showers have a lot work to be done with House keeping 8/10 well they sure know their job well Front office/ operator 3/10 the most hostile welcome u will ever receive. Dont expect ur calls to be ever answered. Dont expect help either. Breakfast buffet the fare is gd but the staff reels with shirtage of manpower and therefore morning blues. Location Not a great part of the city and u need a taxi to go everywhere frm here and the taxis in casablanca ate a rip off. All in all not a hotel i would repeat my stay with.

This hotel should serve as the gold standard for service. From the moment we hit the check-in desk we were treated with utmost importance. The checkin folks saw our family size and asked about any related needs that we might have had. Rooms were clean and overall the hotel was very nice (it could be a 5 star in my books). Thank you.

I booked a room for my son and I. Later, I discovered my daughter would also be travelling with us and requested an extra bed. I was told that for that I would have to get an upgrade for a junior suite, at an extra cost. I agreed to it. On the arrival date, we made the check-in at around 19:00, and once we got to the suite, noticed the third bed was not set and there were only two towels. My son and I left an hour later to have dinner and asked for the bed to be made, and for a menu of the room service to be given to my daughter. Over an hour later, when we arrived back from dinner, my daughter mentioned she had just ordered, and requested again for the set of the extra bed, as the menu never got to her, and she tried with no avail to contact the reception many times. When‚Ä¶

Stayed here twice, the day after arriving and then right before departing Casablanca. I liked the rooms and amenities. The location, hard for me to say as didn't walk around too much, but didn't feel like there was much around the hotel that was of interest to travelers. It was however perfect to get some rest after a long flight.

column3: Nice stay in comfortable and modern hotel
column4: Rooms are spacious, beds comfortable with a modern television and bathroom Personel is available and kind (excepted one person) Only the breakfast is not various and spacious (kitchen too little) enough

The area around the hotel was poor area and so difficult to get in and out from the hotel Also the hotel was warning if you bring your date to the room they will call police they told me because of islamic rolls but in the sane lobby they are selling and serving wine !! What about foreign couples why the allowed to stays together?! What about other hotels in the sane city the also allows dating ! For me also the bathroom was not comfortable.

As usual, radisson blu doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Always a safe bet to stay there. Would definitely stay there again on my um future trips to Casablanca. Location is right in the Center of the city, which is very practical.

Nice, spacious and clean room. I had some trouble figuring out how to get warm water in the shower, but apart from that, everything was perfect. The breakfast was really nice and well balanced. Some more cheeses would have been nice.

We were planning to visit a friend who is working in Casablanca but she had to leave the country for business and so we decided to get a hotel. The Radisson Blu was reasonably priced for mid range hotels and the reputation of Radisson Blu has always been good wherever we have traveled. The front desk staff was very professional upon check in and the quality of the room was also excellent, good bed and though we were on the street side it was not noisy. We decided to go to the bar on the top floor for drinks and to see the city which is a great view, though smoking is allowed and if there is more than one person smoking it can be overwhelming. The breakfast was also great with a good selection of food and good quality. I was consistently impressed by the professionalism of the‚Ä¶

This hotel is very good in it,s rooms and services. The lobby is reasonable. Breakfast was good. Location was ok. I will avoid the location as it was noisy with the tram is very loud. Staff are mix. Some are good but some need to be taught to respect their position and the company they work for. During checking out I had to pay cash for some room service. The amount was 249 Dirham. I gave the cashier/receptionist 400 Dirham and he gave me 60 Dirham only then closed the cashier machine without giving me the bill. I counted the money and showed it to him and without a word he opened the cash machine and handed me the 100 Dirham. Then went to do some work without any apology and again no bill. I talked to mr. Omar. Duty manager and he poromised to see the matter.

wonderful hotel. Very kind and nice hotel staff. particularly Houda, Meryem and Omar excellent customer service. very impressive. plus the rooms are very clean, the location is also good over all fantastic

The ladies at reception made and printed a personalised colouring book for my littles one when they were unwell! Thank you from Muhammad and Husayn. Beautiful well maintained rooms, comfortable beds. Breakfast in the room

The Staff (specifically the management Mohammad Manar, and the other manager Mohammed, and Huda at the reception)of the hotel are one of the most courteous in their accommodations during my stay. The hotel is amazing due exceptional cleanness and service and decorated facilities. I highly recommend this 5 star hotel, and I would add a star and give it 6 star hotel, for the exceptional staff.

column3: Nice hotel marred by disrespectful staff and poor management
column4: Let me start with the positive, before moving on to the horrendous... The hotel has a very nice decor, stylish and elegant. The breakfast was of a high standard with a lot of variety and local dishes. The room was spacious and well appointed. We also visited the rooftop bar, which had a very welcoming vibe at the end of a day of sightseeing. On the whole, the staff was friendly, attentive and welcoming. However, in spite of all this, we did not return to the hotel for a second stay, as we had planned, because of the very rude and insulting treatment by one of the staff. On our second day at the hotel, in the afternoon, my wife and I had a coffee in the lobby and as we entered the lift to go up to our room, one of the porters stopped us and said that the lady at reception needed‚Ä¶

column3: No swimming pool. Breakfast was not up to Radisson standards.
column4: No swimming pool, booked this hotel only because of that. Breakfast was quite poor. Stuff was not changing empty plates. Choices where several and not up to Radisson standards. Hotel was also quite noisy. Could hear the sound all night.

column3: Very good service and beautifull rooftop - also recommend the Yuzu restaurant!
column4: We stayed here for 5 nights to visit Casablanca. Room: we had an upgrade to a room with a view of the city and port of casablanca (due to Expedia booking), which was nice. The room itself is spacious and the bathroom is very modern. Service: The staff is friendly and happy to hep you if you have any questions. The rooftop bar, the lobby bar, the reception desk, breakfast etc every time the service was very good. We met the waiter of the Japanese restaurant in the elevator the first night and he showed us the restaurant and menu. We are big fans of Japan so we ate there our first night and the food was amazing. Location: Casablanca is a bit difficult to visit on foot so it is best to take the tram nearby. You can buy a ticket at the machine (Mohamed Diouri station). The tram‚Ä¶

This hotel is in the city center. We only stayed one night, but we enjoyed good service and a good buffet breakfast. There is a nice rooftop lounge and small swimming pool with a view of Casablanca. Nice people viewing in the hotel lobby.

column3: Got double charged, still waiting for my money back
column4: I arrived a day too early du to business reasons. The receptionist told me to cancel my original booking and assured me there would not be any cancellation fees. I then paid for my stay and after I left, the hotel charged the original booking on my credit card. I have sent mails and calls, but no answer. So I ended up paying twice for no reason and - worse - no feedback What your money if you book there, service is ppor

I have been to this hotel my fourth time this weekend and I thoroughly enjoyed the great service from the Reception team specially Huda and Najib are extremely customer focused and hard working staff. The location is beautiful in the city center and the rooms are lovely and clean. I would strongly recommend this hotel for a pleasure and business.

I stayed 3 nights at this hotel during pandemic. I felt very safe with cleanness of the hotel room, lobby and the breakfast location. I didn't like the mattress because it was very soft. First after check in the allotted me a room at 11th floor, which had smell of smoke, however the hotel people claim that all the rooms are non smoking. After we complained about it, they allotted me another room within no time. I appreciate them for it and also we reached early before checking time but they provided me the room asap. Thanks also due for that gesture. Overall stay was pleasant and healthy.

column3: Excellent stay all round, hard to fault.
column4: The staff were of tremendous help, both Hamza Sabir and Mohamed Manar really could not have been any better. They were attentive and prompt with my requests, nothing was a problem. The room itself was fantastic (Junior suite), the bed was firm without being hard and the shower was powerful and hot. Lastly the breakfast was very good and the choices were more intercontinental than the other hotels I have stayed at in different parts of Morocco (Rabat, Marrakech, Agadir). The only thing missing in my opinion was a lack of USB charging points in the rooms. Nowadays the majority of guests will have multiple items to charge and not enough plug adaptors to cater for them.

column3: Great Service Staff and Very Poor Reception
column4: PCR was done at hotel for 700Derhams. I asked for receipt at least 7 times until I was promised to be sent by email. after 4 reminders I contacted the lab that came to the hotel and they sent me a receipt for 450Derhams. I cannot express how unprofessional this is and I will never get back to this hotel.

column3: Good location, great breakfast buffet, tight rooms
column4: We stayed two nights in this well located downtown hotel. The lobby is fairly small, the rooms are very tight as far as room around the bed and places to spread out your luggage, but we liked the fact that the bathroom had an actual shower, instead of a bathtub with a shower, which is much safer as far as falling. We also likedthe fact that the bathroom was in two separate parts. We appreciated the fact that there were three types of glassware in the room, there was one washcloth at least, the mini fridge, and the large TV. Hallways are very dim.

Hotel is offering an excellent service an has beautiful rooms. For the breakfast the hotel is offering a wide choice. An pool with a bar and an amazing view is located on the last floor (14th floor). We enjoyed staying in this hotel, the only thing which we didn‚Äòt liked that much was the location of the hotel. I would say for business stays it is perfect and for leisure it is ok. Would be great if it would be located at the Marina.

A pleasant stay but breakfast prices very highly for quality of breakfast offered. Try to get breakfast included as it‚Äôs an extortion of it‚Äôs not. Rooms clean and seemed to be clean all over the hotel. Not sure I would stay again as there are better hotels on offer in Casablanca

We had a great time at the Raddison Blu, the rooms are very comfortable, the food is great and the customer service is exceptional. Hotel decor is also very modern and chic. Look out for Nabil, he goes above and beyond to make your stay great.

column3: Could be a nice place if the manager and staff cared
column4: We stayed here the month of July on our visit to Morocco. The hotel appears to be in 'fair' shape with the need for better upkeep. It looks like a very nice facility that has recently suffered some neglect, possibly due to the pandemic. PROS: On the plus side- the breakfast was good. They had a lot of good dishes on the breakfast bar and you could get omelets made to order. Crepes were available as well, along with fresh juices. The breakfast was the high point of the stay. CONS: It is the small things that make me think that the manager and staff have lost focus. For example, we wanted to order room service for dinner and the phone didn't work. I went to the desk and told this to the attendant. Instead of indicating that he would fix the phone, he told me to go over to the‚Ä¶

column3: An Oasis in the Center of Casablanca
column4: The property is fresh and inviting, featuring a modernist decor with hints of tradition. Check-in was smooth with bags delivered quickly, much appreciated after a long journey. Nabil and the crew make the buffet breakfast experience wonderful; be sure to start your day here with a "Nous-Nous" coffee! The location is convenient to the sights at the old medina, the Hassan 2 Mosque, and the Corniche. Beds are firm, with a firm and soft pillow provided. Our upgraded room had a Northerly view of the port, a bonus for ship - spotters or those who want a glimpse of the ocean. Be sure to visit the Le Caprice rooftop bar for a drink, or take a dip in the adjacent pool for a bird's eye view.

Soukauna is such a nice lady. She went out her way to help me. She is not just intelligent but such a strong positive asset to the Hotel. She made my time spent in Casablanca pleasurable and educating me on many things. With all honesty Soukauna is such smart, beautiful lady. I could go on and on, but simply put, she's just GREAT.

Room and lobby are nice. But our room smelled like smoke üö¨. Elevators weren't working following morning and no one seem to cared. The roof top pool and bar is nice and spa is exceptional. Breakfast is very mediocre. Booking website wrongly indicates that hotel has airport shuttle when it doesn't. They charge 500MAD for airport transfer which is outrageous.

everything was at superlative.....staff, cleanless, rooms and meals 5 stars indeed!!!! staff was very polite and helpfull. great breakfast included in the room rate....the room very big and super comfortable

We had the pleasure of staying twice in this hotel on our trip to Casablanca. It's staff are wonderful! Thank you to Houda and her team throughout the hotel. They couldn't have been more helpful and such a pleasure to get to know. I would especially like to mention The Yuzu Restaurant and Mohammed! For anyone who likes Japanese cuisine, it's a definite must! The food was outstanding. Thank you to the fantastic and talented chef and to Mohammed whose recommendations were always perfect. We had the pleasure of dining there twice during our stays in the hotel and both nights were amazing! A dining experience not to be missed!

Loved the hotel. The rooms were impeccably clean and well appointed. Our flight arrived very early and the hotel allowed us to check in at 9am which was very nice. The front desk staff was very helpful, professional and welcoming especially Sou Kaima. Breakfast was good, full buffet with eggs, fruit, breads, yogurt and juices. Omelette and coffees included with request. The entire staff and were a welcome respite from the sometimes overwhelming streets of Casablanca on our first day to Morocco. Highly recommended.

The check-in was very smooth the reception was amazing thanks to Mr.Manar for his assistance and welcoming The service at the restaurant was outstanding the waiter make us feel home..... The room was clean and tidy The whole experience was enjoyable üôÇ

column3: Never use it for your stay in Casablanca
column4: Dinner - only in the room and only sandwiches. We were waiting for sandwiches for an hour , really an hour! Very dirty everywhere, in the bathroom, windows were very, very, very dirty-it was really to difficult to see sun through them.

The hotel was much more comfortable than what we expected. The rooms were in a descent size and the cleanest we ever been in. The best part about the hotel however is the proficiency and hospitality of the staff; especially FATIMA AZZAHRA, the front desk. Fatima helped us generously, providing precious information about places to visit in the Casablanca as well as advice on Covid and how to deal with Covid situation in Morocco. We appreciate it and we have definitely chosen a place for our upcoming stays in Casablanca!

We had a wonderful stay at the Radisson Blu hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. They responded to our requests with a smile and did all they can to handle them. The room itself was nice, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was great. We‚Äôll definitely come back.

This is the fourth time I have stayed at this hotel, and each time I am surprised by the professionalism of the staff, their availability and their kindness. The staff get to know the guests and anticipate their needs before they even ask.

Just stayed overnight. Left luggage to collect late in the afternoon. Room was well furnished with tea/coffee and also good quality bathroom amenities. Staff exceptional. Friendly professional and go the extra mile. I would stay here again

Great and clean hotel, the room was specious and confortable, the rooftop was nice with great view of Casablanca and we really appreciated that this hotel has a great protocol of COVID 19 and our luggage was disinfected and the receptionist Ms Fatimazahraa was really helpful and awesome with us and I really appreciated her welcoming and servicing for us. Only the negative points was food from the room service was not the standard and the taste of Radisson group.

Would like to express my gratitude for the amazing radisson casablanca staff for them professionalism , seriousness and quality service , all went so good , very clean hotel , see you soon thanks again , Imad

Very comfortable stay and was sweetly upgraded to a premium suite room.Harbour view was fantastic.Staff are well trained to greet and welcome you.The only disappointment was the size of the pool.Breakfast was served in the room due to Covid.

Exceptional service, room quality, and food. Friendly and professional staff that made sure to make me feel very welcome. The restaurant offered exotic tastes and healthy natural products. The rooms maintained a very high standard of cleanliness and a great view to match.

The hotel has a great location 3 blocks from the sea port. and close to the market. Lots of restaurants in the area. That said, the Hotel staff is extremely helpful and polite. The hotel itself is dated, carpets in the rooms are showing wear. Overall, good value for the $$$ spent.

I had a great experience, new hotel, beautiful rooms, very helpful staff, everything up to the High Radisson blu Standard and I recommend everyone to stay here when visiting Casablanca. Great location facing a dynamic street, walking distance to all main central points. I will be coming back for sure!

We couldn‚Äôt come to Morocco and not visit Casablanca since I had been infatuated with the name for as long as I remember. We stayed here for two short nights. Location is great since it‚Äôs pretty central, so you can walk. Staff is helpful to solve issues. Hoda at front desk was wonderful to move us from the 9th floor when AC wasn‚Äôt working to 6th floor so we slept so much better on the second night. I visited the Calista Spa (Hamam) and Koutar helped with my appointment. Nadia did a great job with the traditional scrub and I enjoyed the serenity of the beautiful spa. The Sushi restaurant on the M level was enjoyable with good sushi and excellent service. We had an early flight today to leave for Portugal and at first they had a hard time finding our rental car but they found it‚Ä¶

The over all sent in the lobby, corridors and room is most pleasant, as is the pipe music. Check in was quick and efficient, the receptionist was friendly and professional i believe her name started with an H. Sorry for not fully remembering her name. Check out was also good and the gentlemen was also very polite and professional. Offered a cup of coffee upon checkout which doesn't happen to me that often even in 5* hotels these days. My wife and I dined in the restaurant on the lobby level. Food was ok, tasty even though my beef tenderloin was over cooked. I suggest you review your wine list as the first 2 red wines I ordered were not available but third time lucky.

Everyone is friendly and full of smiles. One of the chefs Mohammed was very extra and did all to make us happy. You can actually feel the culture of Casablanca from the hotel lobby just by looking out. Definitely coming back here

Stayed here on our last night in Morocco. The hotel is brand new. Fatima (front desk) was exceptionally helpful when the room access card did not function as expected. We walked to a local restaurant for dinner.

Excellent hotel downtown, walking distance to everything! Brand new hotel. This is a boutique hotel with extremely friendly service. We were greeted by very personable staff and they provided excellent restaurant choices. The hotel is brand new (Nov. 2019), hard wood floors and excellent rooms. The service is impeccable with staff such as Hamza, Mohamed, Youssein and others ... excellent client service! The rooms are beautiful and brand new .... highly recommended! The other hotels in the area are old and dated .... the Radisson Blu is very very good and the staff are amazing! Thank you so much, we really enjoyed our stay and will be recommending to friends and family!

The lobby of the hotel is very impressive as you walk in, very modern and detailed to the maximum. Front desk staff was very welcoming, quickly asked for our passport and credit card. Explain the breakfast in the morning and quickly gave us our room key. We were accompanied by a staff member to show us our room and amenities inside. Nice comfortable size room, very modern and stylish. Lots off wood and stones surfaces, with a wall of glass in the bathroom, with privacy. I got to visit the spa, had a Hammam and a 30 minute back massage. Great experience the staff was very attentive and the place was spotless. I used the pool as well afterwards, nicely warm and calming. Of note the spa is a separate identity, if you want to use the pool you have to pay. The equivalent of $2.50‚Ä¶

The property is new and clean. staff is helpful and speak English. Breakfast buffet left a little to be desired. But this is a good location with lots of shops and restaurants close by. Also the Train runs by the hotel. Couple of frustrating points to me was that no Iron was available if needed and did not get a wake up Call as requested.

It‚Äôs a new hotel, but we got the feeling that the services aren‚Äôt quite ready (or they are already falling apart, which is more worrying). Here are the issues we had with the place: 1. The toilet has poor ventilation. 2. USB outlet didn‚Äôt work, and they didn‚Äôt have adapters for US-style plugs (this was not an issue at any other place we stayed in in Morocco- including a camp in the Sahara). 3. Housekeeping knocked in the door and entered the room without confirmation at 10:30pm for no apparent reason. 4. Hotel faces some dinky apartment buildings. And the curtains don‚Äôt fully close, so you feel they can probably see inside from there. 5. Really thin walls - knock on the neighboring door sounds like it‚Äôs your room. 6. Breakfast was nice, but the restaurant is to be avoided for‚Ä¶

Brand new hotel in downtown Casablanca. Boutique and small. Rooms are nice but too small especially for the beds. Bathrooms are divided by wall WC vs showers. Fully divided which is not convenient. Amenities and services are descent. Breakfast not so bad with not do wide selection.

My family and I visited Casablanca and had a great time staying at the Radisson blu! Mohammad‚Äôs service during breakfast was amazing and he treated us like we were his visiting family - funny jokes, playing with the kids, and always smiling and ready to help. Younis was also very amazing as he would walk me to get snacks and change for the trams! Amazing service!

Friendly staff, clean room and all facilities are available. Should be visited while you landed in casa. Location in Central to close to old Town and near the ocean. A bit far from morroco mall. I strongly recommend to visit it.

I usually do not write reviews but here I have to. I spent one night in the hotel with my 2 kids as we were in transit and I have to say that I was really impressed by the people working in this hotel. Very nice people, very careful with all the guests. congratulations, this is definitely a place I recommend as you feel at home.

column3: Wonderful great place to stay in in casa
column4: Great place to stay in wether you are on business or leisure. the stuff are are very professional they speak very good English, French, Spanish and of course Arabic. I am just amazed how disciplined and professional they are le service est fiable. C√¥t√© propret√© nickel tr√®s propre. L‚Äôaccueil est chaleureux i highly recommend it. Stay blessed. I really appreciate the stuff Yousra, Khadija, Nabil, Mohamed, Kamal, Adil, .... sorry if I missed one of the stuff. My experience there is just amazing I really enjoyed my stay there love you and thanks for making my stay great.

Incompetent staff with very limited English False information about usage of hotel facilities Value for money is low. Comfortable beds and beautiful bathroom. Great tee and coffee selection in the room.

column3: One of the best hotel in the city
column4: The hotel was very nicely decorated but most importantly the level of customer service exceeded my expectations. Miss Asmaa went beyond what was expect of her to help her clients feel comfortable & safe. Will most definitely stay in the hotel again on my next visit.

column3: New & Neat And very clean hotel with nice smile everywhere
column4: Excellent experience Nice place for a business trip People are very friendly and humble Special thanks to Houda & Khadija & Fatima Zahra & Adam & Nabil & Lemdasny and to all the nice staff. I do recommend the hotel for a business trip.

Big fan of this new hotel in Casablanca and we‚Äôll certainly make it my regular booking when I come to Casablanca in the future. The F & B Manager Asmaa took great care of me and my guests and meeting went perfectly - √† bient√¥t! Saed

I've stayed in for several days, and i would say that my time there was perfect, its location in the center of casablanca, made access to a lot of places much easier. the hotel has a great welcoming staff, their attention to details and willingness to accommodate my needs made for a very pleasant experience.

column3: 1st hotel during our visit to Morroco.
column4: A bran new hotel in Casablanca, arrived first day of innoguration. Everyting is great - the room, a reach breakfast buffet, the crew doen't stop satisfying you. An excellent location in this city. We stayed two nights - hoping to come again.

I Mr. Williams Amoako arrived from Accra Ghana here at Radisson hitel on the 4th of November. So far so good the workers are nice The service at the front desk Soo beautiful. Just to mention few workers like Fatema , Asmaa and the rest I don't have all their names but from the restaurant to the front desk Room service very supper. Thank you all for your hospitality I love you all I think my next visit to Morroco I promise to come back to Radisson hotel here . My next visit will be like am coming to look for a Wife üòÅ.

I will endorse Radisson Blu Hotel, Casablanca for anybody travelling to Morocco, particularly Casablanca. Great service they have.Fine attendants with quite an appreciable level of tolerance. Very cozy rooms as well.
